value: Scrolls and leaves held in place by bars with picots.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George Nichols from the collection of her mother, Mrs. J.P. Morgan

label: Description
value: Blue and green changeable silk coat with collar, cuffs, pockets, and front and back openings embroidered with soft polychrome silks in design of icicles with pendant sprays of minute pansies, daisies and pinks; alternating with monogram "I.C.", decorated with rosette and feathery foliage. Lined throughout with ivory silk plain twill. Buttons covered of same material and embroidered with minute flowers. Sleeve lining of linen plain cloth.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk fancy cloth embroidered with silks, and lined with silk plain twill Technique: embroidered

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (Height of Center back; Shoulder Width): 106.7 × 27.9 cm (42 × 11 in.)

label: Description
value: Blue and green changeable silk breeches with knee cuffs embroidered with soft polychrome silks in design of icicles with pendant spray of minute flowers, alternating with the monogram "I.C.", decorated with feathery foliage. Cuffs and top lined with white linen plain cloth.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk fancy cloth embroidered with silks and faced with linen plain cloth Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value: Gentleman's collarless waistcoat has an ivory ground with narrow vertical stripes of horizontal ribs. Between these stripes are other narrow vertical stripes composed alternately of single flower sprigs and intertwining ribbon and vine serpentines. Buttons of self-fabric. False buttonholes on pockets. Back and lining of fine linen plain weave. Fronts faced with white silk plain weave.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, linen back Technique: compound weave

label: Description
value: Handscreen in the form of a mask. Design of pastel-colored feathers tied with a bowknot;  the loops of the bow are cut out for use as eye-holes.

label: Physical description
value: Linen leaf embroidered with silk, turned wood handle

label: Description
value: Square panel of deep blue velvet. Uncut ground with the design in cut pile of small-scale cloud motifs arranged to form quatrefoil and large medallions, each enclosing a scene showing four men engaged in the same activities: fishing, gathering firewood and reading. Edges bound with gold and blue compound satin. Backed with light blue cotton plain weave cloth.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, cotton backing Technique: cut and uncut supplementary warp pile (velvet)

label: Description
value: Interlaced circles or "Seven-treasures" (shippo) is an appropriation of older motifs. Shippō is an auspicious design which is a popular motif on women's kimonos, primarily worn in times of need of good luck, such as weddings and new year's. Drill punching and pull carving have been applied to create this detailed motif. There is a bit of staining located near the bottom of the image.

label: Physical description
value: Mulberry paper (kozo washi) treated with fermented persimmon tannin (kakishibu)

label: Description
value: Roll composed of six sections of silk sewed end to end; one end pasted to paper on wooden roll, other pasted to paper serving as cover and bearing inscription.  Silk printed with 105 small-scale repeating patterns, largely in dot and lozenge designs, in white on a blue ground.  Patterns are in rectangles of various widths, arranged in five lengthwise bands.
